headline: Biggest rail union joins others in endorsing Union Pacific merger but some still have reservations
summary: The nation's largest railroad union joined the list of companies endorsing Union Pacific's proposed $85 billion acquisition of Norfolk Southern Monday after securing promises to protect jobs, but other unions and chemical makers that rely on the railroads are still expressing concerns about the deal.  The SMART-TD union that represents conductors and other rail workers said Union Pacific put CEO Jim Vena's promise not to lay off any of its workers as a result of the merger in writing and promised to protect their jobs throughout their careers.  The union's endorsement comes just days after President Donald Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that he deal sounds good to him, but groups like the American Chemistry Council and the Rail Customer Coalition have said they worry that allowing two of the six largest railroads to merge will only hurt competition and lead to even higher shipping rates.

content.title: Biggest rail union joins others in endorsing Union Pacific merger but some still have reservations
content.summary: The nation's largest railroad union joined the list of companies endorsing Union Pacific's proposed $85 billion acquisition of Norfolk Southern Monday after securing promises to protect jobs, but other unions and chemical makers that rely on the railroads are still expressing concerns about the deal.  The SMART-TD union that represents conductors and other rail workers said Union Pacific put CEO Jim Vena's promise not to lay off any of its workers as a result of the merger in writing and promised to protect their jobs throughout their careers.  The union's endorsement comes just days after President Donald Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that he deal sounds good to him, but groups like the American Chemistry Council and the Rail Customer Coalition have said they worry that allowing two of the six largest railroads to merge will only hurt competition and lead to even higher shipping rates.

headline: Trump, Top Labor Group Signal Support for Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern Merger
summary: Endorsements from the president and the nation’s largest rail union boost momentum for a deal that would create the first modern U.S. transcontinental railroad.

content.title: Trump, Top Labor Group Signal Support for Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern Merger

headline: Why Norfolk Southern (NSC) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of freight transportation company Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) jumped 2.6% in the afternoon session after the largest U.S. railroad union backed its proposed $72 billion acquisition by Union Pacific following a landmark job security agreement.

content.title: Why Norfolk Southern (NSC) Stock Is Up Today
content.summary: Shares of freight transportation company Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) jumped 2.6% in the afternoon session after the largest U.S. railroad union backed its proposed $72 billion acquisition by Union Pacific following a landmark job security agreement.

headline: Largest US rail union endorses Union Pacific, Norfolk Southern merger
summary: (Reuters) -The largest U.S. railroad union said Monday it will support Union Pacific's $85 billion acquisition of Norfolk Southern, helping to advance a deal that surprised competitors and had been expected to face resistance from labor and regulators.  The endorsement marks a shift from the initial opposition by SMART-TD, the transportation division of the International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers.  When the merger was announced in July, the union said it would oppose the deal on concerns about job security, competition and infrastructure access.

content.title: Largest US rail union endorses Union Pacific, Norfolk Southern merger
content.summary: (Reuters) -The largest U.S. railroad union said Monday it will support Union Pacific's $85 billion acquisition of Norfolk Southern, helping to advance a deal that surprised competitors and had been expected to face resistance from labor and regulators.  The endorsement marks a shift from the initial opposition by SMART-TD, the transportation division of the International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers.  When the merger was announced in July, the union said it would oppose the deal on concerns about job security, competition and infrastructure access.

headline: SMART-TD and Union Pacific Announce Landmark Agreement Securing Jobs and the Future of Railroading
summary: OMAHA, Neb. & INDEPENDENCE, Ohio, September 22, 2025--The International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers – Transportation Division (SMART-TD), the nation’s largest railroad union, and Union Pacific Railroad, the nation’s largest railroad, today announced a historic agreement ensuring job security for thousands of railroad workers as Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern pursue a proposed merger.

content.title: SMART-TD and Union Pacific Announce Landmark Agreement Securing Jobs and the Future of Railroading
content.summary: OMAHA, Neb. & INDEPENDENCE, Ohio, September 22, 2025--The International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers – Transportation Division (SMART-TD), the nation’s largest railroad union, and Union Pacific Railroad, the nation’s largest railroad, today announced a historic agreement ensuring job security for thousands of railroad workers as Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern pursue a proposed merger.

summary: Twelve of the large-scale development areas are located on short-line railroads.
